French police launch nationwide crackdown on undocumented migrants
subhead: More than 4,000 police and military officials swept through train stations across France with orders to detain undocumented migrants on Wednesday and Thursday. Unions and rights groups denounced what they called 'roundups.'

title: Chinese cities are facing the financial abyss of their subway systems
subhead: After high-speed rail, subway lines are now dragging the cities they serve into huge levels of debt. This is due to colossal construction and operating costs, minimal revenues and a toxic relationship with real estate developers.

title: Blanketing an entire continent with forests: Why planting trees cannot make up for fossil fuel emissions
subhead: A new study assesses the cost of carbon offsetting, a practice increasingly used by oil and gas companies, and calculates the amount of land that would need to be covered with forests if all coal, oil, and gas reserves worldwide were burned.

title: 'Iran's nuclear obsession could lead to endless, if not fatal, weakening of the Islamic Republic'
subhead: The war that Israel is waging in Iran is the culmination of a cycle that began nearly 40 years ago, during the early days of Iran's theocracy, writes Le Monde's columnist Alain Frachon.

How Trump broke with his strategic allies to side with Russia over Ukraine
subhead: 'The Transatlantic Divorce' (5/5). After Barack Obama stepped back during the 2014 annexation of Crimea and Joe Biden hesitated, Donald Trump, now back in the White House, aligned himself with Russia at the UN and left his strategic allies alone to face Vladimir Putin.

title: War in Ukraine has been a social elevator for part of the Russian population
subhead: A study by the French Institute of International Relations (IFRI) examines the war in Ukraine's socio-economic impact, from the jobs created by the military-industrial complex to salaries and bonuses distributed to soldiers.

title: Why Paris's Centre Pompidou, not even 50 years old, must close for five years
subhead: The building designed by Renzo Piano and Richard Rogers is set to undergo major renovations until 2030 in order to reduce its energy consumption by 40%. Since its opening in 1977, the space has been in constant transformation.
